com.cube.storm.ui.controller.adapter

Class StormListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.cube.storm.ui.controller.adapter.StormListAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter, ListAdapter, SpinnerAdapter

    public class StormListAdapter
extends BaseAdapter
    The base adapter used for displaying Storm views in a list. Using an adapter to do such a task has the benefit of view recycling which makes the content smooth to scroll.

    This adapter only supports Model classes which have a defined Holder counter-class.

    Usage

    Problems Problems can arise with this method of rendering content, specifically with render efficiency where the views are not being recycled because there is only 1 of its view type in the list. This is the equivalent of having all of the views inflated into a ScrollView. The smoothness of the scrolling (depending on how much content there is) diminishes with the amount of unique content that the list is rendering.

      • setItems

        public void setItems(Collection<? extends Model> items)
        Sets the items in the collection. Filters out any model that does not have a defined Holder
        Parameters:
        items - The new items to set. Can be null to clear the list.
